main event: On August 16, 1956, a civilian in Fitchburg, Massachusetts, observed eight spherical objects in red and green colors, moving in a scattered formation for a total of about eight minutes before fading from sight. The objects were seen moving from west behind clouds in an erratic pattern.
interesting points: The sighting involved eight spherical objects in red and green colors, observed for approximately eight minutes.
The objects were moving in a scattered formation and appeared to fade from sight after being visually observed for eight minutes.
The observer noted a total of six objects, with some moving from west behind clouds and others racing in an erratic pattern.
The conclusion from the observation was that it was considered to be air refueling operations, although the nature of the objects remained unknown.
The document indicated that there were no photographs of the observed objects.
sighted object: eight spherical objects in red and green colors
